review: Relatively inexpensive and works great!  Previously I was using an HDMI cable hooked up to my computer; this works much better and saves on battery power.  Casting works in a pretty wide radius, I was able to cast from my phone in my room to the television in the living room.Downsides I've found thus far:- Slight lag/multiple tries for pausing using iPhone as a remote- No Amazon Instant Video- Limited success in streaming videos from a chrome browser (not YouTube)Overall I'm very satisfied and would recommend to others.

review: I've tried multiple ways to stream content from my DroboFS to my TV: Xbox Media Center, Verizon FIOS's media streamer, Fuppes (directly from the Drobo). None of them can stream as consistently or as easily AND without lag as the Chromecast using the Plex.tv app. I finally cancelled my Cable TV subscription. Sure it doesn't stream Amazon yet, but my Xbox does, so I'm good with that.I haven't taken it on the road yet, but I was just at a conference and someone told me how they use it in hotels all the time. Next time I have a week-long business trip, I'll try that myself.I've had a Sonos playbar for a few months and the audio sounds great from the Blu-Ray rips I'm streaming from the Drobo upstairs to the Chromecast. I added a pair of Play:1's as rear surrounds and now the audio's even better.The only "con" is that it can't connect to 5Ghz wi-fi. However, I've not had any issue with that yet, so no reason to ding it a star.
